frameDefinitions: The Agent is assigned to a Post where he or she performs a task associated with that Post.
An Employer employs an Employee whose Position entails that the Employee perform certain Tasks in exchange for Compensation.
An Employee has a Position doing work in a particular Field, or doing work on a particular Task, for which an Employer gives Compensation to the Employee.
A Whole separates into Parts, or one part of a whole, called Part_1, becomes separate from the remaining portion, Part_2.
A Member is semi-permanently part of a socially constructed Group.
A Signatory signs an Agreement document, thereby taking on a commitment encoded in the Agreement.  '.
frameExamples: I <t>employed</t> him as Chief Gardener for ten years.
Undocumented foreigners are <t>working</t> as  building contractors for Laing Builders.
This small channel meanders through marsh and wetland, <t>splitting</t> into several smaller channels that empty into Lake St. Clair.
Victor is <t>part</t> of the Red Crescent
. During this time, 84 countries (including the United States) <t>signed</t> the Protocol.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is assigned to a <fen>Post</fen> to perform a task involving a <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
The <fen>Post</fen> is a location or station assigned to the <fen>Agent</fen> where a task or tasks are to be performed.
The <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is centrally involved in the task the <fen>Agent</fen> is assigned to perform. It is normally located at the <fen>Post</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> works at the <fen>Post</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> staffs the <fen>Post</fen>.
The role <fen>Employee</fen> denotes the person who is obligated to perform some <fen>Task</fen> in order to receive <fen>Compensation</fen>.
The <fen>Employer</fen> is the person (or institution) that gives <fen>Compensation</fen> to an <fen>Employee</fen>.
The role <fen>Field</fen> identifies the field in which the <fen>Employee</fen> is employed.
The role <fen>Position</fen> indicates a particular type of employment.
The <fen>Task</fen> indicates the action/duty that the <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to do for the <fen>Employer</fen>.
The role <fen>Time</fen> identifies the time at whcih the <fen>Employer</fen> hires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The role <fen>Place</fen> identifies the location where the <fen>Employer</fen> hires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to perform a <fen>Task</fen> in order to receive <fen>Compensation</fen>.
The <fen>Employer</fen> gives <fen>Compensation</fen> to an <fen>Employee</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place_of_employment</fen> of the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The label given to a particular type of employment.
The <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to perform the <fen>Task</fen> to recieve <fen>Compensation</fen> from the <fen>Employer</fen> .
This role identifies the <fen>Field</fen> in which one works.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> period during which an <fen>Employee</fen>  works for an <fen>Employer</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Employee</fen> works.
The <fen>Whole</fen> is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which separates into <fen>Parts</fen>.
This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole:
Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned.
Part_2 is the second of two Parts mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the separation occurs.
Where the separation occurs.
The person who belongs to a <fen>Group</fen>.
A set of people standing in a semi-permanent relationship together.
The time at which the <fen>Member</fen> is a member of the <fen>Group</fen>.
The location where the membership relationship holds.
The signatory of the <fen>Agreement</fen>.
The entity signifying the identity of the <fen>Signatory</fen>, resulting from the act of writing on the <fen>Agreement</fen> document.
The document which encodes the commitment of the <fen>Signatory</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which signature is given.
The place where the signing occurs.
